intro: Myosotis cameroonensis, commonly known as the Cameroon forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon in Central Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often prostrate. Myosotis cameroonensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
